title: Matchsafe, ""The Whitehead & Hoag Company"", 1900–10
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, with rounded corners, upper and bottom edges slightly curved, featuring printed advertisement in black typeface on off-white background: "Compliments of The Whitehead & Hoag Co., High Grade Advertising Novelties with Merit. Newark, N.J., Branches in all large Cities." "Whitehead & Hoag Co.,Newark, N.J." in very fine print below. Reverse features color illustration of nude male with bird-like wings and diaphanous red fabric draped across his body; he embraces nude female with small blue, fairy-like wings. Lid hinged on side. Striker in recessed groove on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, ""The Whitehead & Hoag Company"", 1900–10.
1900–10. Plated metal, printed celluloid. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-1357.
